c74object.name: the.mc.jit.amygdala
c74object.digest: Rebuild a signal-driven, poly-dimensional named matrix during offline video rendering.
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Iterates through and thereby rebuilds realtime recorded matrix states (using the.mc.jit.amygdala~) and is to be placed after any named jit.matrix populated by the latter using multi-channel signals.
It supports matrices of any dimcount between 0 and 13 with multiple planes.
Its counterpart the.mc.jit.amygdala~ is to be fed with a multi-channel signal, likewise replacing a corresponding jit.poke~.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context to bind to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. the.jit.thalamus with a unique context name is required running in parallel for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

objarg.name: matrix-name
objarg.description: The name of the jit_matrix to access (default = 0). Identical to the matrix used before with jit.poke

attribute.name: autoclear
attribute.description:
Clear the matrix before recording. Ensures that later video rendering will start out clean regardless of its most recent state.
autoclear is enabled (1) by default
Unlike the.mc.jit.amygdala~—where autoclear purges the recording matrix—the matrix being cleared in this case is the actual target matrix.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 4 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = ignore this object and pass everything through without recording or recalling
1 = operate normally (default); playback, record and output during rendering
2 = (idle)
3 = playback and record normally but do not output data during rendering
4 = record and output during rendering but never pass incoming data
5 = mute all activity

method.name: jit_matrix
method.description:
To implement the.mc.jit.amygdala, it should be placed after the named matrix it replaces during offline nredering.
During playback mode of the.jit.thalamus the named input matrix is passed through unaffected.
